UnitType.Quote: You attempt to enslave the power of elemental, but I will not be bound. Come within my reach and I will burn you to nothing more than a darkened husk.
UnitType.Backstory: This is the greatest among Fire Elementals, surpassed only by Delin himself.

UnitType.Quote: There is more to fear than the cold in the arctic...
UnitType.Backstory:
In the time before this one - before the coming of the Titans, before the Cataclysm that sundered the world - lesser Elementals such as these served as attendants to the Elemental Lords, those who men worshipped as the Five of Anthuane. These creatures were called Anathua for this reason; they were thought to be the physical manifestation of the magic of the shards, which they were never far from. That time has passed. The Lesser Elementals know no allegiance now; they are as likely as not to attack without warning.
The Ice Elemental's weakness is fire; it is immune to cold, and all poisons of the world as well.

UnitType.Quote: When the earth rises, you would do well to fear...
UnitType.Backstory: The creatures known as Crag Spawn appear to be a variety of Earth Elemental; less powerful but more prone to violence than their larger cousins. They hate men, especially miners, and are fond of collapsing mines by destroying the tunnel braces. They then use the miners' picks and hammers to pull bones out of the trapped miners in a gross parody of the miners' work. For these reasons, some have speculated that these creatures were created by Morrigan, or his allies among the Fallen.

UnitType.Quote: There is more to fear than the cold in the arctic...
UnitType.Backstory:
In the time before this one - before the coming of the Titans, before the Cataclysm that sundered the world - lesser Elementals such as these served as attendants to the Elemental Lords, those who men worshipped as the Five of Anthuane. These creatures were called Anathua for this reason; they were thought to be the physical manifestation of the magic of the shards, which they were never far from. That time has passed. The Lesser Elementals know no allegiance now; they are as likely as not to attack without warning.
The Ice Elemental's weakness is fire; it is immune to cold, and all poisons of the world as well.
This Ocean spirit will faithfully scout the waves for you, and even transport units.

The branches, moss, and leaves of an entire forest, magically fused together into a battlefield monster. They are slow, but hit with terrifying power. They can even summon wild animals to fight with them.

UnitType.Quote: You are you nothing more than insects scurrying upon the shell of the world.
UnitType.Backstory: A monster meant to terrorize the vast space below the ocean's surface. The appearance of this monster's head has only ever been followed by terrible calamity.

UnitType.Quote: When the earth rises, you would do well to fear.
UnitType.Backstory: Only a channeler deep in the favor of Earth can call one of these creatures forth. It is a mighty soldier of mountain flesh, so attuned to Earth that it can walk over mountain, chasm, or even water.
This creature only appears in service to a master of winds: it can overwhelm enemies with wind abilities, then retreat with its allies in the blink of an eye.
